Art. 4.133. 
Prohibition of gifts with an obligation to preserve for the benefit of another 
Any gift by which the beneficiary is charged with conserving the property received so that it can be transmitted to a subsequent beneficiary is null, even as regards the beneficiary.   This rule does not apply to dispositions permitted to fathers and mothers and to brothers and sisters, in sub-title 6. ¤ 2 A disposition by which a third person is called upon to receive a gift, in the event that the beneficiary does not receive it, is not regarded as a gift with a charge of conservation in favour of another person, and is valid.
The same applies to a gift whereby the usufruct is given to one person and the bare ownership to another.
